qas.question: What was the name of the Christian reconquest of Iberia from the Muslims?
How many major Christian kingdoms existed in Iberia around 1150?
Along with León, Portugal, Aragon and Castile, what major Christian kingdom existed in Iberia around 1150?
What Islamic state controlled southern Iberia until 1031?
What Islamic state controlled southern Iberia in the 1170s?

context: In Iberia, the Christian states, which had been confined to the north-western part of the peninsula, began to push back against the Islamic states in the south, a period known as <a0_0>the Reconquista<a0_0/>. By about 1150, the Christian north had coalesced into the <a1_0>five<a1_0/> major kingdoms of León, Castile, Aragon, <a2_0>Navarre<a2_0/>, and Portugal. Southern Iberia remained under control of Islamic states, initially under <a3_0>the Caliphate of Córdoba<a3_0/>, which broke up in 1031 into a shifting number of petty states known as taifas, who fought with the Christians until <a4_0>the Almohad Caliphate<a4_0/> re-established centralised rule over Southern Iberia in the 1170s. Christian forces advanced again in the early 13th century, culminating in the capture of Seville in 1248.
